projects.name: Refresh Central - WebEx BOT
projects.summary: Developed and executed a proof-of-concept Cisco WebEx bot named 'Refresh Central - WebEx Bot' using JavaScript and a custom WebEx bot API. The bot enhances client interaction by seamlessly retrieving and presenting diverse report data. It intelligently generates Excel-format reports for general inquiries and employs interactive cards in the chat room for more specific requests, prompting users for inputs such as time, location, and other parameters. Notably, the bot efficiently handles general inventory inquiries, providing detailed information on product availability and quantities upon request.The success of the project was well-received by the client, who expressed appreciation for its functionality and efficiency. As a testament to its value, the client was in the planning stages of incorporating the 'Refresh Central - WebEx Bot' into their existing project for broader integration and enhanced workflow.

projects.name: My Blog
projects.summary: Developed a blog using Hugo and Blowfish, showcasing my proficiency in learning Hugo for the first time. The project serves as a comprehensive record of my learning journey, highlighting key insights and lessons learned, with the intent of providing a valuable resource for others in the field.

projects.name: This Portfolio
projects.summary: My Personal Portfolio started in the Year 2023.Developed in 2023 with the power duo of React and TailwindCSS, my portfolio is not just a showcase but a reflection of my passion for creating visually stunning and interactive web experiences.Embracing modernity, I've incorporated React-icons for a sleek iconography, and seamless navigation is powered by react-scroll.Migrated to Vite for Better and Faster Build Process. The communication channel is fueled by EmailJS, making it easier than ever for users to connect with me.Experience the site in your preferred style with both Dark and Light Themes seamlessly integrated. It's not just a portfolio, it's an immersive journey through the art and science of web development.I've ensured a smooth and engaging experience on the go by making it fully responsive for mobile usage.

projects.name: ECDelivery
projects.summary: Developed ECDelivery, an Angular 16-based e-commerce clone styled with Tailwind CSS and featuring a sleek dark theme. The website integrates a dummy API for realistic product data, includes a functional shopping cart, and implements smooth routing and search functionalities. A separate route for product categories. Through this project, I gained expertise in advanced Angular development, styling with Tailwind CSS, and the implementation of e-commerce features.

projects.name: Taskmanager
projects.summary: Developed a dynamic task management application with a reactive form for adding and editing tasks, a Task List component for displaying tasks, and a Task Service for efficient task management. The application features routing with two routes and a navigation bar for easy switching between the Task List and task addition.

projects.name: Angular Weather & Counter App
projects.summary: This project comprises two Angular applications - Increment/Decrement Counter App and Weather App. The Counter App enables users to manage multiple counters with options to increment, decrement, and delete them. The Weather App utilizes the OpenWeather API to fetch weather data for specified cities and displays detailed forecasts.

projects.name: Sample Grid layout
projects.summary: A Sample Layout with a grid of users and some navbars and filters writem in HTML,CSS & Bootstrap

projects.name: Profile-2020
projects.summary: Excited to revisit my earlier days in web development with the unveiling of my 2020 Profile Project.Crafted during the quest to master HTML and CSS, this project is a nostalgic nod to my learning journey. While simplicity is key, the website structure is powered by HTML, and the styling is brought to life with the magic touch of CSS. It's a testament to the humble beginnings, where every tag and style declaration marked a step forward in the exciting world of web development.

projects.name: Anim-page-2020
projects.summary: Excited to revisit a fun project from my early days of learning HTML & CSS – introducing "Animanga".Crafted with passion and a sprinkle of creativity, this vintage gem is a testament to my journey in web development. HTML laid the foundation for the website structure, while CSS added the stylistic flair that brings Animanga to life.

projects.name: Automation of fans using LM-35 sensor
projects.summary: Excited to share a highlight from my college days—a IOT project that blends technology and convenience. In this project, I engineered a system veraging an IR sensor to intelligently detect room occupancy. The magic doesn't stop there—this marvel automatically controls the fan, adjusting its speed based on temperature while keeping a meticulous count of the number of occupants.The heart of the system? An Arduino board, where, despite being new to embedded C, I tackled the challenge by drawing on my familiarity with C. The result: a seamless fusion of innovation and adaptation.

projects.name: Electricity consumption indicator
projects.summary: Excited to unveil a project from my college days that brings electricity consumption tracking to the next level! In this venture, I crafted a sophisticated system utilizing an Arduino board and a general-use electric meter to measure usage in units per month. But it doesn't stop there—I incorporated pulse readings to calculate costs, giving customers a comprehensive view of their energy consumption. Adding a touch of data magic, I designed graphical analyses to identify consumption patterns and pricing trends. And here's the twist—I navigated the embedded systems realm with code written in a language with a striking resemblance to C, despite being a novice in embedded C.
